definition: oboe-like musical instrument used in folk music of Gansu, Qinghai etc/(onom.) meow/kitty kitty!/Mimi (Western name)/tits (i.e. slang for breasts)

sentences.english: Mimi completely defused after listen to hypocrisy, turn to Lou issa says congratulations.

sentences.english: "That's right, " says the doctor. He then begins to fondle her breasts.

sentences.english: Mimi" likes to lie onthe floor in the sunshine. She feels;comfortable that way.

sentences.english: First, why not give her a breast massage?

sentences.english: Mammograms also use radiation, but in smaller doses.

sentences.english: Mrs. Li takes her dog Mimi for a walk after dinner every day in their neighbourhood.
sentences.chinese: 李天太每天晚饭后都要带她的小狗咪咪在小区里散步。

sentences.english: Mimi comfort lesser, grandpa will be fine, jingjing has been blame her.

sentences.english: This cat should have a name. How about Mimi?
sentences.chinese: 这只猫应该有个名字。叫咪咪怎么样？

sentences.english: The teacher then smiles at us.
sentences.chinese: 而老师则笑咪咪的望着我们。

sentences.english: Yong He , Mimi Gates , Ban Wang, Jianxia Liu in Columbia university.

sentences.english: Sure, Mimi. What can I do for you?
sentences.chinese: 当然可以，咪咪我能为你做什么？

sentences.english: I like "Mimi" very much because the cat brings us a joy of the family.
sentences.chinese: 我非常喜欢“咪咪”，因为它给我们家带来了欢乐。

definition: (pet name for a baby or small child)
auntie, youngest of sisters in mother's family
drat/frick/(euphemistic variant of 媽的|妈的[ma1 de5])
